args:
The sword Alberius drew was a sacred blade
named Dragalia. Handed down for generations
by the Ilian Church, it can be wielded only by
those in whom the dragonblood flows.
After telling him this, Myriam requests his
cooperation in the war against Dyrenell.
The power of this sword is extraordinary!
That is the sacred sword Dragalia,\nhanded down through the Ilian Church.
It is said to be the very pactstone which\nserved to mark the bond between\nthe Goddess and the Holywyrm.
I have been waiting for you, bearer of the\ndragonblood. Since the distant era of Ilia\nherself, I have awaited you.
I don't understand any of this.
Then let me start at the beginning.\nI am Myriam, an emissary of the Church.
The Church tasked me with transporting\nthe sacred sword from the Curia to a\ncathedral in South Grastaea.
And you claim this sword to be not only a\npactstone, but the pactstone of Elysium,\nthe ruler of this world.
Yes. It is said this sword was given to Ilia\nby Elysium, which is why we have sworn\nto guard it to this very day.
I find it hard to believe the pactstone of\nthe Holywyrm is in the hands of humans.
It is said the Holywyrm granted us this\nsacred sword so we might stand against\nthe great evil of Morsayati, the Other.
I know Morsayati: He is the overlord of the\notherworld who Ilia and Elysium defeated\nafter forging their pact.
Yes. But here we are, seven hundred years\nhence, and the world is on the cusp of\nbeing menaced by the Other once more.
Because the cruel Dyrenell Empire\nworships the creature and plots to\nsee him brought back to life, right?
Originally, Dyrenell was a collection\nof devout believers in Ilia.

But somewhere along the line, they came
to believe the Other represented true
righteousness and turned against the
Ilian Church.
Now they seek to offer the world itself to\nthe Other, and have started a new war\nof aggression to that end.

I thought this whole ＂Other＂ business was
merely a pretext for expanding territory,
but based on those soldiers, they seem to
believe in the cause body and soul.
It's said they found a way to contact the\nsealed Other and borrow his grim power.
That would also explain how a small\nisland nation suddenly gained the power\nto launch a war of this magnitude.
Indeed. Already no fewer than five nations\nhave fallen under Dyrenell rule.
The Ilian Church has brought together an\nallied coalition of nations in the south\nin order to halt their advance, but...
But the fight goes poorly, I assume.
＂When the Other's fell shadow darkens the\nworld once more, a hero of dragonblood\nshall appear.＂

＂Let the bond between Holywyrm and
Goddess be the blade by which they
quell the resurgent evil and preserve
the order of the world entire.＂
Pretty, after a fashion. What is it?

A prophecy of the Ilian Church; one which
tells of the Other's restoration, as well as
the appearance of a hero who will draw
the sacred sword to save the world.
But few believe the prophecy now,\nfor none have been able to wield the\nsword over the centuries.
Yet we've no choice but to cling to those\nancient words for hope and succor.
And now you stand here possessed of the\ndragonblood and able to wield the blade!\nTruly, this is divine providence.
You have used the term ＂dragonblood＂\nseveral times now, but I know not what\nit refers to. Can you explain?
And while you're at it, perhaps you can\nexplain why I seem to have it.
The dragonblood is a bloodline that\narose seven hundred years ago when\nIlia and Elysium swore their pact.

When their compact was sealed, those
who were showered with light released
from the pactstone gained the power to
form their own pacts with dragons.
It is said those with the dragonblood\nare able to pass it down through\ngenerations to this very day.
And thus to me as well.
Yes! You are exactly the dragonblood hero\nwe have been waiting for!
Please, great Alberius!\nGrant us your guidance!
Enough. I'm not the hero type.
Then fight with us—or even stand at\nour side if you've no taste for war!
Having the dragonblood hero with us\nis sure to bring hope to the people.\nPlease, I beg it of you!
That's rather a large request to spring\non a man you've only just met.
Yes, your words do rather carry\nan air of selfishness.
If Alberius is indeed the dragonblood hero\nas you proclaim, he will no doubt be\npressured to fight.
And in the end, he will be forced to bear\nthe burden of being a hero, whether he\nwishes such a thing or not. Am I mistaken?
I have clearly hit the mark—in which case,\nit seems your purpose here was deception!
Easy, Midgardsormr. I think this woman\nmeant well enough.
Honestly, I always viewed the Other\nand the war as someone else's concern,\nso the idea of stepping right into it...
I fear I cannot answer you now; I need\ntime to see the world and view this\nproblem as my own. Will you grant this?
Still, the Empire is clearly aiming to get\ntheir hands on this sword, so I'll at least\nescort you to this cathedral of yours.
I thank you for your consideration,\nO great and heroic Alberius!
I'm no hero yet! For now, you can think\nof me as a mere traveling companion.
And on that note, let's ease off all the\ngrand titles and just call me ＂Alberius,＂\nall right?
Of course, O grea... Er, I mean...Alberius.\nDid I do it right?
It suits you better. Trust me,\nI'm good with these sorts of things.
You cannot reason with this man; he does\nwhatever he wants, and doesn't take no\nfor an answer.
If you are laboring under the fantasy that\nhe will become some sort of grand hero,\nI warn you to revise your thinking.
Yes, I see what you mean.
Enough talking, you two. Let us be off!
